definitions.definition: A person whom one does not know; a person who is neither a friend nor an acquaintance.
definitions.example: That gentleman is a stranger to me.  Children are taught not to talk to strangers.

definitions.definition: One not admitted to communion or fellowship.
One who has not been seen for a long time.
One not belonging to the family or household; a guest; a visitor.
One not privy or party to an act, contract, or title; a mere intruder or intermeddler; one who interferes without right.
definitions.example: Actual possession of land gives a good title against a stranger having no title.

definitions.definition: A superstitious premonition of the coming of a visitor by a bit of stalk in a cup of tea, the guttering of a candle, etc.
